nodes.text: 80-HD was a protocol droid on Coruscant during the Clone Wars. He suffered from a malfunctioning voice module.
80-HD would have been a background character in the cancelled video game Star Wars 1313. His malfunctioning voice module would have made him "rap" in an erroneous manner.

On April 28, 2017, composer Jesse Harlin revealed the name of 80-HD when he replied to a tweet of fan art of a 3PO-series protocol droid wearing clothes. In the reply, Harlin stated: "At LucasArts working on Star Wars: 1313, I was writing hip-hop for a malfunctioning protocol droid named 80-HD. He probably looked like this." In 2016, Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy stated that cancelled content from Star Wars: 1313 may be further developed in other media in the future.

"80-HD" is a common misspelling of ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder), and is a reference to the fictional rap artist of the same name from the LucasArts video games Thrillville and Thrillville:Off the Rails. Harlin served as a composer on both games alongside David W. Collins and Alistair Lindsay.
